humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, there were 3 lymph nodes examined and all of them were negative for tumor (part 2 and part 3). This information aligns with New Rule 11, which states that N0 can indicate that all assessed lymph nodes are negative for metastatic carcinoma. Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N0.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that two sentinel lymph nodes were biopsied and both were negative for tumor (Part 2, nodes 1 and 2). This means that there is no evidence of cancer in the lymph nodes, which corresponds to an N0 stage. The N stage is not affected by the substaging information.
